decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo quickly to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, which can win the game in one swing. The deck includes multiple ways to search for and protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption, and deal with opposing threats through removal spells. The key strategy is to efficiently combo off while controlling the game and outpacing the opponent's threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Elvish Reclaimer, and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to slow down the opponent and protect the combo. Other cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Stitcher's Supplier provide graveyard synergy and additional threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent while assembling the Dark Depths combo to achieve a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. By using cards like Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Elvish Reclaimer to search for Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, the deck aims to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just a few turns. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and control the opponent's hand. Overall, the strategy focuses on quickly setting up the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to cheat powerful, game-winning creatures into play quickly by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. By bypassing traditional mana costs and using fast mana like Lotus Petal, City of Traitors, and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can drop massive threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand as early as the first turn. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond, using counterspells like Force of Will to protect the combo. It's a high-risk, high-reward deck that can easily win games in a single turn.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It uses cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Sylvan Scrying to search for the combo pieces, while also disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Wasteland to deal with opposing threats. It aims to win the game by creating a powerful creature that can quickly end the match.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Blood Sun, while also deploying aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Seasoned Pyromancer to close out the game. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and slow down the opponent's plays with cards like Trinisphere. This deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells, using its mana acceleration and lock-out effects to maintain control of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures such as Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine, then use cards like Altar of Dementia and Carrion Feeder to sacrifice these creatures and bring back Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. This allows for a rapid and powerful combo to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own combo. The synergy between graveyard recursion and sacrifice outlets is crucial for the deck's success.

The deck focuses on using cards like Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill opponent's library in combination with Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast for disruption. It also utilizes Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and fetch important tools like Ensnaring Bridge. Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon can disrupt opponents' mana base while cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer provide additional combo pieces and flexibility. The deck aims to create a lock on the opponent while assembling its combo pieces for a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It combines disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will with evasive threats like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to deal repeated damage. The deck also incorporates powerful card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain a consistent stream of threats. The inclusion of Ninjas like Baleful Strix and Spellstutter Sprite allows for additional value and disruption.Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and versatile creatures while controlling the game with valuable spells.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana using fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Lion's Eye Diamond, and casting spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to fuel the storm count for a massive Tendrils of Agony finish. Along the way, the deck uses cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thoughtseize to sculpt the perfect hand, while also including disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Burning Wish allows the deck to access powerful sideboard cards, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to slow down the opponent's game plan. It utilizes powerful threats like Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to close out the game. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult to deal with threat, while Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler help to control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to out-value the opponent through efficient card advantage and disruption, while also having the flexibility to pivot between controlling the board and applying pressure.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively control the game by using efficient counterspells and removal spells while quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, Hexdrinker, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze and Force of Will while generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Wrenn and Six. The land base is designed to ensure consistent mana access and also disrupt the opponent with Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, True-Name Nemesis, and Hexdrinker, backed up by disruptive spells like Spell Pierce, Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Snare. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Magmatic Sinkhole while maintaining card advantage and deck manipulation through cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Wrenn and Six. The mana base is built around efficiently casting the spells with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using Show and Tell and Omniscience. It focuses on assembling the necessary combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Flusterstorm and Force of Will. Narset, Parter of Veils provides card advantage and helps to filter through the deck, while Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility by accessing sideboard cards when needed. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and game-ending plays.

The focus of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Council's Judgment, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own threats. Stoneforge Mystic allows for efficient equipment tutoring, while cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler offer powerful card advantage and tempo advantage. The main win condition revolves around the efficient beatdown plan with creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Batterskull, providing a strong and resilient finish to the game.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo using cards like Vampire Hexmage, Thespian's Stage, and Crop Rotation. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo, such as Sylvan Safekeeper and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Additionally, the deck has disruption elements like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Abrupt Decay to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and win the game through the powerful Dark Depths combo.
